messages.subject: Re: 2292 SOS my daughter wants to try school again
messages.msgSnippet: on 8/27/02 2:39 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at ... Dear Mary, That is just beautiful. Thanks.  I hope the person who wrote the other post sees her
messages.messageBody:
on 8/27/02 2:39 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> Message: 4
> Date: Mon, 26 Aug 2002 20:07:26 -0600
> From: "zenmomma *" <zenmomma@...>
> Subject: Re: SOS my daughter wants to try school again
>
>>> But I am going to make her live up to the commitment. Attendance will be
>>> my sticking point.>>
>
> Why? Why make her give a commitment at all? Why not think of this as just
> another unschooling experience? If she decides she doesn't like it, finds it
> boring, hates the tacky social scene, why make her stick it out? Wouldn't it
> be so much sweeter to just let her learn those lessons and return back home?
> After all, wouldn't that be the better outcome anyway?
>
> Life is good.
> ~Mary

Dear Mary, That is just beautiful. Thanks. I hope the person who wrote the
other post sees her own words, "I am going to make her......"

NV
